programme.title: Il guusto di Igles
programme.desc: S15 - Un crostaceo molto saporito, le canocchie nella cucina di Igles ben si associano ad un piatto di spaghetti. I consigli di Igles per un buon sugo di canocchie e uno sformato di canocchie

programme.title: I panini li fa Max
programme.desc: Gustosi, originali, iconici e fantasiosi. I panini di Max sono la ricetta ideale per un pranzo goloso, una merenda veloce o una cena in compagnia.

programme.title: Casa Casetta
programme.desc: Giorgione, dopo tanto peregrinare in giro per l'Italia, torna a casa, dove tutte le sue piacevoli avventure culinarie sono iniziate, per deliziarci con laidi e corrotti test

programme.title: La mia Sardegna
programme.desc: Il tramonto prima dell'alba - Il viaggio parte da Alghero per arrivare a Capo Caccia ad ammirare uno dei tramonti più suggestivi della Sardegna. Durante il viaggio incontrerà amici chef e vignaioli che racconteranno le loro storie e i loro progetti

programme.title: Neogrania dal campo al forno
programme.desc: La nuova frontiera del grano, un progetto che mira a creare nuove varietà di grano, ecosostenibili e resistenti. L'approccio di panificatori, pasticceri e pastai a questi grani.

programme.title: Con le mani in pasta
programme.desc: Nonna Valeria di Palombara Sabina prepara le pittule con ragù di salsiccia e una croccante pizza fritta con lo zucchero

programme.title: Del pane non butto via niente
programme.desc: Pane di Nola ep1 - Pane di Nola, un pane che dura diversi giorni e diventa più buono quando non è freschissimo. Il tempo di lievitazione di questo impasto è di 24 ore, lievito madre e forno a legna completano l’opera. Le ricette di Peppe per questo pane.

programme.title: Ritratto di chef
programme.desc: Davide Di Fabio - Un cuoco proiettato nel futuro con una spiccata sensibilità per la tutela dell'ambiente che lo ha portato ad essere certificato come il primo ristorante Plastic free d'Italia

programme.title: Ritratto di chef
programme.desc: Davide Di Fabio - Un cuoco proiettato nel futuro con una spiccata sensibilità per la tutela dell'ambiente che lo ha portato ad essere certificato come il primo ristorante Plastic free d'Italia

programme.title: Malborghetto
programme.desc: Dal mare ai monti il viaggio di Fabrizio Nonis in Friuli Venezia Giulia. Un patrimonio di bellezza, unicità, natura incontaminata, di luoghi da scoprire e di sapori da gustare

programme.title: Parola di chef
programme.desc: Il punto di vista di un giovane talento della ristorazione italiana che si racconta svelando le proprie soddisfazioni, difficoltà, aspirazioni, in un percorso tra pubblico e privato.

programme.title: Basilicata food stories
programme.desc: Tette delle monache - Per Domingo una tappa dolce a Matera per mangiare la Tetta della monaca, prima di immergersi negli ingredienti della ricetta di questo episodio

programme.title: Il guusto di Igles
programme.desc: S15 - Le tecniche di lavorazione degli ingredienti e i consigli per utilizzare al meglio tutte le parti della faraona. Le ricette spiegate passo passo per realizzare a casa anche questi piatti.

programme.title: Fuoco Calabria
programme.desc: Pecorino crotonese DOP - Cosa c'è di più ancestrale del fuoco? In questa serie Max invita a fare un salto nel passato utilizzando il fuoco come unica fonte di calore per le sue ricette.

programme.title: Casa Casetta

programme.title: Cheese Hunters S3
programme.desc: Ep1 - Eleonora e Fiorenzo partono alla scoperta del Parmigiano Reggiano. Le terre dove vengono coltivati i foraggi per le mucche, la raccolta del latte, le fasi della lavorazione e la stagionatura.

programme.title: Cook Like a Chef
programme.desc: Alliums include staples like onions, garlic, leeks, and chives"... you'll love Chef Derek Dammann's skillful tips and tricks for using them all!

programme.title: Bonacini's Italy
programme.desc: Puglia's lush landscape and large coastline characterize its cuisine. Chef Michael Bonacini explores its native ingredients through some of Puglia's favourite meals. First up, Michael's antipasto is a guaranteed crunchy bite with crispy Fried Mussels. Stepping away from the sea, Michael highlights Puglia's prize crop: tomatoes! Combining colourful tomatoes with flavourful burrata cheese, Michael cooks up comfort in a bowl with his Tomato and Burrata Risotto. Taking on a more festive flair, Michael introduces us to Little Pork Bombs, the hottest street food in Puglia. With a filling of fresh herbs and melted cheese, these pork skewers are savoury and irresistible. Then, Michael introduces...

programme.title: Bonacini's Italy
programme.desc: Simplicity is key with Sicilian cuisine and Chef Michael Bonacini explores just how the region balances simplicity with intensity through four flavourful dishes. Starting with an antipasto of Folded Flatbread with Ricotta and Fennel Seeds, Michael inspires with its intricate beauty with a simple recipe. Keeping to the theme of simplicity, Michael shows that plenty of flavour can come from little ingredients in his primo of Broccoli and Sausage Rigatoni. The spicy sausage and chili is countered by a creamy broccoli pesto for a dish that highlights Sicilian cuisine. Michael turns to the Italian queen of crops for his secondo: Eggplant Parmesan Roll-Ups. With thin slices of eggplant rolled...

programme.title: Bonacini's Italy
programme.desc: Filled with ruins in its bustling streets, the region of Lazio sticks with grandeur in all it does, including food! To introduce us to Lazio, Host Michael Bonacini highlights its Jewish influence with a crispy Roman Jewish-style Artichokes. As crunchy as a potato chip, Michael's artichokes are a delicious fried treat that are a perfect way to kick off a delicious meal. For his primo Michael brings together simple ingredients to create a rich Bucatini with Amatriciana Sauce. Michael's secondo turns what was once peasant food into a delectable and tender dish. Cooked with a blend of vegetables and sauce, Michael's Braised Oxtail brings forth the history of cuisine. Returning to Rome for his...

programme.title: Bonacini's Italy
programme.desc: Campania's beautiful coastline is filled with two things: tourists and seafood. Diving into the culture of the region, Celebrity Chef Michael Bonacini begins his meal with a salad from the Island of Capri. Putting a twist on the classic dish, Michael's Grilled Caprese Salad combines fresh tomatoes, tangy balsamic, and a hint of sweetness from basil. For his primo, Michael serves up bold flavours with his Spaghetti Puttanesca. Mixing salty and sweet, this sauce offers a delicious take on the typical plate of spaghetti. Looking to the coast for his secondo, Michael quickly cooks up aromatic and spicy Herb-stuffed Scallops and Grilled Broccoli Rabe. For his dolce Michael whips up a dessert...

programme.title: CombiNation Plates
programme.desc: CombiNATION time! Barbados is the sun-drenched island of enchantment where Chef Craig starts this culinary adventure. Check out Bajan Spice Snapper with Curried Pumpkin for a Caribbean taste sensation! Next comes a feast for the eyes with Oxtail PasÌŒticada from Croatia, served with a truffle sauce that melts in your mouth, and also in your heart! Turns out that both of these countries love... shrimp! Check out the Croatian creation with tomatoes and plum brandy; for Barbados? It's grilled with spice and dipped in mango-chili sauce. The Big Dish is Monkfish wrapped in PrsÌŒut, a smoky Croatian dry-cured ham, served with scotch bonnet-spiked tomatoes and Barbadian Cou cou made with corn...

programme.title: CombiNation Plates
programme.desc: First up, Belgium is famous for its mussels and fries, aka 'Moule Frite'. Chef Wong has a unique take featuring Belgian beer steamed mussels salad, waffle cut fries, and potato-leek mousse. Next, Steak Madagascar is an old school fine-dining fave, this take, uses modernist 'spherification' for the sauce, and a vanilla bean rub for a steak that is decidedly not 'old school', wow! For a common ingredient, how about sweet breakfast? Belgians are famous for Liege Waffles, and Madagascar loves Mofogasy, a pancake made with rice flour and coconut. The final dish is inspired by Belgian Waterzooi, a root veggie stew, mixed with a popular Malagesy stir-fry with shellfish and pork... Chef carefully...

programme.title: CombiNation Plates
programme.desc: Tiraditos! No, it's not a joyous exclamation (even though it sounds a little like one...) it's a Peruvian dish that lands somewhere between traditional Peruvian ceviche and Japanese sashimi. Chef Craig Wong's version is made with swordfish and includes sweet potatoes pureed with spicy Aji Amarillo chilies. For his Lebanese tribute, check out Lamb Neck cured and slow-poached in olive oil for a melt-in- your-mouth result, paired with an intense, flavourful Black Baba Ghanoush made with charred eggplant and caramelized onions. For a common ingredient, it is two takes on potato: Lomo Saltado with grilled flank steak, and a cheese, herb, olive oil and lemon drenched Hasselback Batata Harra....

programme.title: CombiNation Plates
programme.desc: This CombiNation Plates culinary adventure starts in Portugal with a Scallop dish that features some of their finest ingredients, such as Port Wine, ChouricÌ§o sausage, Kale, and Figs. Next up is South Africa and the feature is an Ostrich Steak, served with native Cape Gooseberries, the bizarrely named "Monkey Gland Sauce" (don't worry, no monkeys and very few glands are involved). The common ingredient is Peri Peri peppers, featured first on a Grilled Sardine with Olive Soil for a peak Portugal experience, then on the Peri Peri Chicken dish that South Africa made internationally famous. The combination plate is always the big finale... Stand back in awe for Chef Craig's Giant Braaied...

This is not your average turkey dinner. First, Robert marinates the turkey pieces in lime, yogourt and garlic. After infusing basmati rice with aromatic saffron and bay leaves, Robert tosses the rice...

programme.title: Bonacini's Italy
programme.desc: Puglia's lush landscape and large coastline characterize its cuisine. Chef Michael Bonacini explores its native ingredients through some of Puglia's favourite meals. First up, Michael's antipasto is a guaranteed crunchy bite with crispy Fried Mussels. Stepping away from the sea, Michael highlights Puglia's prize crop: tomatoes! Combining colourful tomatoes with flavourful burrata cheese, Michael cooks up comfort in a bowl with his Tomato and Burrata Risotto. Taking on a more festive flair, Michael introduces us to Little Pork Bombs, the hottest street food in Puglia. With a filling of fresh herbs and melted cheese, these pork skewers are savoury and irresistible. Then, Michael introduces...

programme.title: Bonacini's Italy
programme.desc: Simplicity is key with Sicilian cuisine and Chef Michael Bonacini explores just how the region balances simplicity with intensity through four flavourful dishes. Starting with an antipasto of Folded Flatbread with Ricotta and Fennel Seeds, Michael inspires with its intricate beauty with a simple recipe. Keeping to the theme of simplicity, Michael shows that plenty of flavour can come from little ingredients in his primo of Broccoli and Sausage Rigatoni. The spicy sausage and chili is countered by a creamy broccoli pesto for a dish that highlights Sicilian cuisine. Michael turns to the Italian queen of crops for his secondo: Eggplant Parmesan Roll-Ups. With thin slices of eggplant rolled...

programme.desc: First up, Belgium is famous for its mussels and fries, aka 'Moule Frite'. Chef Wong has a unique take featuring Belgian beer steamed mussels salad, waffle cut fries, and potato-leek mousse. Next, Steak Madagascar is an old school fine-dining fave, this take, uses modernist 'spherification' for the sauce, and a vanilla bean rub for a steak that is decidedly not 'old school', wow! For a common ingredient, how about sweet breakfast? Belgians are famous for Liege Waffles, and Madagascar loves Mofogasy, a pancake made with rice flour and coconut. The final dish is inspired by Belgian Waterzooi, a root veggie stew, mixed with a popular Malagesy stir-fry with shellfish and pork... Chef carefully...

programme.desc: Host Theresa Visintin creates savoury meals in this letter "R" challenge featuring radicchios and raisins. First, Theresa chops up bold and bitter radicchios, grilling them until the edges are a crispy golden brown and perfect for a warm wedge salad. Then, she tosses fried pancetta and earthy portobello mushrooms in a luxurious champagne vinegar and pours it over the crispy radicchio. Theresa tops this warm salad with creamy crumbled goat's cheese. For her next dish, Theresa prepares a rum raisin sauce using golden sultana raisins, dark rum, and fresh orange. Theresa pours the sauce over succulent ham. Is your mouth watering yet? Finally, Theresa combines radicchio and raisin into a...

programme.title: A is for Apple
programme.desc: It's all about pork and peanuts, today's challenge is the letter "P." Chef Lauren Gulyas serves up an old school favourite, smothered pork chops. Using a blend of savoury ingredients, and with the help of her cast iron pan, Chef Lauren provides us with tips on how to keep your pork tender and tasty. Next, it's time for a West African peanut soup. Drizzling garlic, ginger and onions with extra virgin olive oil and letting them sizzle in a frying pan until the onions are soft brings out a sweetness that lends itself beautifully to the salty, earthy taste of peanuts. To finish, Chef Lauren puts an Asian twist on a southern classic, when she combines the two ingredients.

programme.desc: Chef Michael Bonacini highlights the tiny region of Molise, exposing some of its best kept savoury secrets. Starting with a classic, Michael cooks up a delicious multi-layered Chicory Timbale, a pie filled with fresh chicory, ripe roma tomatoes, and sliced prosciutto. To crisp up the top of the pie, Michael tops his delicious dish with finely grated pecorino cheese and crunchy breadcrumbs. Next up, Michael's primo is a spicy Octopus in Purgatory. This tender, colourful, and sumptuous dish is sure to impress in both looks and taste! For his secondo, Michael cooks up a traditional Marinated Rabbit. Stewed in wine, tomatoes, and chilies, this rustic dish will have your guests asking for...

programme.title: Bonacini's Italy
programme.desc: Delving into the cold mountainous region of Valle D'Aosta, Celebrity chef Michael Bonacini whips up a meal of four hearty dishes that are sure to warm up any chilly day. First up is Michael's antipasto of Wild Mushrooms and Lardo on Rye. Coated with rich, earthy mushrooms, buttery fontina cheese, and savoury cured pork, this decadent dish highlights a combination of iconic flavours from Valle D'Aosta. Next up is a twist on traditional pasta with Valle D'Aosta's unique Chestnut Fettucine topped with Sweet Pork and Earthy Cabbage. The secret to this dish? Chestnut flour to create a denser, sweeter, and nuttier pasta. For his secondo, Michael turns to the pride of the region, Fontina cheese,...

programme.title: Bonacini's Italy
programme.desc: The popular region of Tuscany is known for its wines, cheeses, and gorgeous sights. Chef Michael Bonacini introduces us to Tuscany's fine cuisine with four of his favourite dishes. Michael draws attention to the importance of mushrooms in Tuscan culture with an antipasto: Many Mushroom soup. Warm, hearty, and full of earthy flavour, Michael tops this soup with fried sage leaves to combine comfort and crunch in a single bite. For his primo, Michael explores a Tuscan favourite - Lamb Ragu! Served over pici noodles, Michael's rich ragu is complemented by fresh, light herbs. Then, Michael serves up a Porchetta-Style Duck, a crispy and tender secondo. To bring his meal together, Michael ends...

programme.title: Bonacini's Italy
programme.desc: From hearty inland crops to fresh food of the sea, the Venetian region covers it all. Host Michael Bonacini begins with the sea as he serves up an antipasto of succulent Soft Shell Crab. Michael pairs the crab with a Tangy Aioli made from sundried tomatoes, creating the perfect combination of crispy and creamy. Moving inland for his primo, Michael twists together two classic Venetian dishes to make a new favourite: Radicchio Risotto! With his secondo, Michael cooks up a light and creamy Pancetta-Wrapper Snapper with Pea Mash. Sweet and tender, this dish will melt in your mouth. Whether you're in the mood to share or feeling a little selfish, Michael's Giant Almond Crumb Biscuit covers it...

programme.title: CombiNation Plates
programme.desc: CombiNATION Plates is television's best travel show that never leaves the kitchen. Skilled Chef Craig Wong is your host, and prepare to be blown away by his takes on the foods of France and Vietnam. First up? A re-write of a popular Vietnamese street snack made with Clams and Sesame Rice Noodles. Next? Marrow Toast dresses up in its tux and tails for a version made with King Oyster Mushrooms and Sauce Bordelaise. The common ingredient is Baguette; check out supersonic versions of French Jambon Beurre and Vietnamese Banh Mi. The Big Dish blends delicate sole with ProvencÌ§ale flavour spiked Nuoc Cham and a crunchy Haricot Amandine inspired Vietnamese crepe.

programme.title: CombiNation Plates
programme.desc: Go-to Indian menu item Lamb Rogan Josh is one thing, but Lamb Sweetbreads Rogan Josh with Aloo Gobi Foam? That's a CombiNATION Plates thing! Craig Wong is at it again in this USA + India episode. After India, Chef moves on to the USA to answer the question, 'is everything better battered and fried?' with his Country Fried Torchon of Foie Gras. The common ingredient for these two distant nations is lobster, and really, who doesn't love it? For the US, it's Lobster with Cajun Spice Grits and Pickled Okra, and for India, check out Lobster Curry with Coconut Milk. The finale features Catfish like you've never seen it. Cooked Tandoori style and served with Collard Greens Paneer and Peach...

With creamy Skyr style with Blueberries representing Iceland and an Avocado Lime sensation for Jamaica that only Chef Wong could pull off, made in mere moments with liquid nitrogen! programme.desc: Taking in Gisborne's tranquil cliff-lined coastlines, driftwood, and rushing waves; going lakeside in the Twizel region to explore snow-covered mountain ranges and the calm surface of the lake waters.

programme.title: Watu Leter & Goa Cina Beach: Indonesia
programme.desc: Exploring the remote coasts of Indonesian beaches with limestone stacks in the bay.

programme.title: Blue Horizons
programme.desc: Featuring a diverse set of blue nature scenes from places like Hawaii, Mexico, Canada and California paired with a custom ambient track by Travis Revell.

programme.title: Xplore Czech Republic
programme.desc: The ancient silver mining town of Kutná Hora was the second most important town in the medieval Kingdom of Bohemia after Prague. Rohan Patoley learns about the erstwhile glories of the town at the former royal mint, the Italian court, and soaks in the romance of the quaint winery, Vinné Sklepy. He also attends the Royal Silvering Festival, an annual Gothic celebration recalling the town’s rich past.

programme.title: Quest
programme.desc: The pillowy goodness of Bengali sweets is even more famous in India than some of Kolkata’s landmarks. Alex, however, sets out to discover the forgotten sweets of Bengal. She meets some veteran sweet shop owners in the city, who show her how to make some lesser-known traditional sweets.

programme.title: Xplore Czech Republic
programme.desc: Pilsen boasts of a majestic Baroque town square and magnificent Gothic churches but to the world, it will always be known as the birthplace of the world’s first and arguably best lager beer, Pilsner Urquell. Rohan Patoley takes the tour of the most famous brewery at the town that has been practicing the art of brewing beer over 700 years.

programme.title: 10 Days Estonia
programme.desc: Tallinn, Estonia’s capital, is known for its quaint, medieval Old Town but Italian nomad couple, Marco and Erica discover other sides to the city by visiting offbeat attractions such as the Seaplane Harbour Museum and Telliskivi Creative City, a hub of artists. They also tuck into a medieval feast at Olde Hansa Inn. Following this, they have an off-roading adventure at Aidu oil shale quarry.

programme.title: Xp Guide
programme.desc: Considering Singapore’s reputation as a glitzy, fast-paced, ultra-urbanized city, Sukhmani is surprised at the pockets of nature it offers.

programme.title: Timeless Tamil Nadu
programme.desc: In the 8th century AD, a town on the Coromandel coast became a lab for the kings of the Pallava dynasty to conduct their architectural experiments. Centuries later, Alex visits the world-famous rock-cut temples and cave shrines of Mahabalipuram to explore the styles of architecture that were innovated by kings, who are often called the pioneers of South Indian architecture.

programme.title: Backpack
programme.desc: Sabrina visits Zodiac fountain and then Jaffa Port. She then explores National Park in Caesarea. Ending the episode as learns about Baha'i faith.

programme.title: Backpack
programme.desc: Sabrina visits Zodiac fountain and then Jaffa Port. She then explores National Park in Caesarea. Ending the episode as learns about Baha'i faith.

programme.title: 10 Days Scotland
programme.desc: Robbie’s adventures in Perth kick off with him immersing himself in the historic grandeur of the Scone Castle, where a mysterious stone tells tales of Scottish monarchs. But the real thunder of the Highlands awaits at the Braemar Games gathering, where tartan meets brawn, and Robbie learns that embracing his Scottish side involves more than just kilts and castles.

programme.title: Backpack Serbia
programme.desc: Heather explores Novi Sad, the financial and industrial hub of Serbia.Starting with canoeing on Danube and later exploring the city and its landmarks.

programme.title: Boarding Pass
programme.desc: Emeline Nsingi Nkosi goes to Santa Village at Rovaniemi, where she reads some of the letters that children from around the world write to him.

programme.title: Xplore Bulgaria
programme.desc: Luxurious hotels, thrilling water parks, inexpensive food and almost 300 days of bright sunny weather make Bulgaria’s biggest seaside resort, Sunny Beach popular for budget beach getaways. Catriona, however, stumbles onto the historic town of Nessebar, which is over 3000 years old, and realizes that there is more to the place than meets the eye. She goes on to visit the Castra Rubra winery, where she finds out about the history of Viticulture in Bulgaria and the process of wine making.

programme.title: City Breaks
programme.desc: Benafsha embarks on a whirlwind adventure in Ahmedabad. With just 48 hours in the city, she is determined to make the most of it, but how?

programme.title: Food Fact Fun
programme.desc: From exploring a vintage car museum to scaling a 5 meter ice-wall and sampling a rich bread cookie, Watch Alex exploring The Hague, also known as the “International city of peace”.

programme.title: 10 Days Scotland
programme.desc: A modern European oil city built on the back of a rich maritime heritage, Aberdeen is the energetic kingpin of northeast Scotland. While the boom times may come and go, the dynamic coastal metropolis never ceases to thrill with its free museums, outdoor adventures and natural attractions right on the city’s doorstep.

programme.title: Backpack Serbia
programme.desc: Heather explores Požarevac and visits the ancient town of Viminacium. Later visits National Museum, concluding with Majdanpek’s Rajkova Pecina Caves.

programme.title: Boarding Pass
programme.desc: Emeline Nsingi Nkosi goes to Rovaniemi, where she visits a husky farm and finds out about about breeding and raising huskies.

programme.title: Xplore Bulgaria
programme.desc: For the people of Sofia, preserving its heritage is sacrosanct, and this can be seen in the way the city's infrastructure is built around its archeological treasures. Catriona realizes this when she roams around the cobblestone streets of the city. With every monument she visits, she finds herself transported to a different era, right from Perperikon fort, which narrate stories of the Byzantine empire, to Boyana church, which is home to some of the earliest examples of medieval artwork.

programme.title: Great World Hotels
programme.desc: From lazing in hammocks by the beach to sipping drinks on a private yacht, Kim realizes that Maldives is the perfect destination to unwind in style.

programme.title: Food Fact Fun
programme.desc: From trying dishes like Stroopwafel and Palat Stoofvlees to visiting the Erasmus bridge, cube houses and wall painting on the streets, Alex explores Rotterdam.

programme.title: 10 Days Scotland
programme.desc: Since medieval times Aberdeenshire and its northwestern neighbour Moray have been the richest and most fertile regions of the Highlands. Aberdeenshire is famed for its Aberdeen Angus beef cattle, its many fine castles and the prosperous 'granite city' of Aberdeen.

programme.title: Backpack Serbia
programme.desc: Explore Majdanpek with our host as the city brings the viewers closer to the treasures strewn across the Serbian countryside.

programme.title: Boarding Pass
programme.desc: Levi is Finland's largest and fastest-growing ski destination. Emeline is here, to find out the exciting activities that Levi offers, in summer.

programme.title: Xplore Bhutan
programme.desc: With snow-capped peaks rising over primeval forests and traditional villages, Paro is like an Oriental Switzerland. On a visit to Paro, Radhika explores famous monasteries such as the Rinpung Dzong and Takstang Monastery, and learns the history and legends associated with them. Along the way, she finds out the secrets to the quintessential Bhutanese peace and contentment.

programme.title: Great World Hotels
programme.desc: An invigorating spa treatment, a cooking lesson, a snorkeling session – Kim has experiences in the Maldives that leave her completely rejuvenated.

programme.title: Food Fact Fun
programme.desc: From trying Orange zest beer and traditional Dutch dishes to exploring St.Martin's Cathedral, Dom Tower and enjoying go karting and stand up paddle boat ride, watch Alex enjoy his trip in Utrecht.

programme.title: 10 Days Scotland
programme.desc: In the enchanting landscapes of Inverness, Robbie’s journey takes a whimsical turn: from eccentric to downright magical.

programme.title: Backpack Serbia
programme.desc: Heather explores Nis,one of the oldest cities in Europe.She visits a concentration camp and later paraglides to end by watching a musical performance.

programme.title: Boarding Pass
programme.desc: Emeline goes to Ruka-Kuusamo, where she tries river rafting. She also meets a reindeer herder,who tells her about the unique ways of herding reindeer.

programme.title: Xplore Bhutan
programme.desc: Actress and travel enthusiast, Radhika Bangia explores the enigma that is Bhutan, when she visits Thimpu, the capital city with no traffic lights and no skyscrapers invading the skyline. Here, she checks out significant sights such as the Tibetan-style National Memorial Chorten, the National Library and the Folk Heritage Museum in order to understand more about the beliefs, history, architecture and cuisine of Bhutan.

programme.title: World Heritage
programme.desc: Explore the ancient heritage sites of Abu Simbel, the Philae complex of Nubia and the Hatshepsut Temple to unravel the mystical stories behind the ancient temples of Egypt.

programme.title: Food Fact Fun
programme.desc: Alex tries traditional Dutch food in Leiden, learns about Dutch history at Prinsenhof Museum, visits a Gothic church, a local cheese market and Delftware factory at Gouda.

programme.title: 10 Days Scotland
programme.desc: The grand finale of Robbie’s wild homecoming unfolds amidst the rugged beauty of the Isle of Skye.

programme.title: Backpack Serbia
programme.desc: Continue exploring Serbia with Heather as she visits the Manasija monastery, Resavska caves, ending with a joyride onboard Eight of Sargan rail line.

programme.title: With Love From Mauritius
programme.desc: Krisann and Nathan’s vacation in Mauritius begins in Le Morne, where an unexpected adventure awaits the latter.

programme.title: Xplore Bhutan
programme.desc: Known as Druk Yul or the “Land of the Thunder Dragon”, Bhutan is the country of mountains, monasteries and mystery. Radhika Bangia finds this to be true when she visits Punakha, the former capital of Bhutan, where she marvels at the architecture of Punakha Dzong and gets to know the story behind the two rivers, Mo Chhu and Po Chhu. She also explores the sacred temples and Mebar Tsho lake of Bumthang, the religious heart of Bhutan, and gets to know the local legends.

programme.title: World Spas
programme.desc: Jamie Srubis tries out spa treatments, which are inspired by the Dead Sea and the desert surroundings at Hotel Kempinski Ishtar in Jordan.

programme.title: Food Fact Fun
programme.desc: After Burj Khalifa, Alex has a traditional Emirati platter, visits the gold market and skiing rink, and goes for a camel safari and camping.

programme.title: City break
programme.desc: Nestled in the mighty Alps, tour the Austrian city of Innsbruck with Sabrina and explore a town that’s alpine-urban yet traditional in nature.

programme.title: Backpack Serbia
programme.desc: In her final leg of journey, Heather visits the Uvac canyon, tries locally prepared pie, ending with Kopaonik National Park and Jelovarnik waterfalls.

programme.title: With Love From Mauritius
programme.desc: On an island-hopping adventure in Mauritius, Krisann and Nathan find out that time works differently on these islands.

programme.title: XP Guide
programme.desc: A homely place where the aroma of freshly baked bread greets you as people smoothly glide along on their bicycles. Welcome to Copenhagen.

programme.title: Unwind
programme.desc: Indeya explores the Cinnamon plantations, tries a local dish and witnesses a traditional dance performance.

programme.title: Food Fact Fun
programme.desc: Alex has varied experiences in Dubai like trying Lebanese cheese bread, visiting a coffee museum, going to IMG Worlds of Adventure and more.

programme.title: Food Fact Fun
programme.desc: In Amsterdam, Alex tries Bitterballen, cannabis cake and visits Heineken Experience brewery. He explores Zaanse Schans village with windmills and Coster Diamonds, the oldest diamond polishing factory.

programme.title: 10 Days Scotland
programme.desc: Robbie’s journey to reconnect with his Scottish roots begins in Edinburgh, the stunning capital city perched on extinct volcanoes. Navigating the twists of the Royal Mile, strutting around the majestic Edinburgh castle and learning to sip scotch like a true Scotsman, he feels a tad closer to his heritage. The real fun kicks in, however, when he stumbles onto a rather flamboyant way to unleash his inner Highlander.

programme.title: Xplore Bulgaria
programme.desc: Like Rome, Plovdiv straddles seven hills; but as Europe’s oldest continuously inhabited city, it’s far more ancient. As Catriona takes a tour of the city to see its iconic attractions such as a Roman Amphitheatre, which was once the setting for gladiator fights, and the striking Baroque Saints Constantine and Helena Church, she begins to see how seamlessly modern life blends with the age-old ruins. Along the way, she realizes why Plovdiv is called the ‘Eternal City’ of Bulgaria.

programme.title: XP Guide
programme.desc: Stockholm, the capital and largest city of Sweden, was built on 14 Islands. This place is also sometimes referred as Venice of the north.

programme.title: City Breaks
programme.desc: This exhilarating city of castles, beer and segway rides can take you on a break that will truly leave you catching your breath.

programme.title: Backpack Serbia
programme.desc: Visit Belgrade, with Heather as she explores the city, its architecture and learns about its past by visiting historical monuments.

programme.title: 10 Days Scotland
programme.desc: Robbie’s adventures in Perth kick off with him immersing himself in the historic grandeur of the Scone Castle, where a mysterious stone tells tales of Scottish monarchs. But the real thunder of the Highlands awaits at the Braemar Games gathering, where tartan meets brawn, and Robbie learns that embracing his Scottish side involves more than just kilts and castles.

programme.title: Backpack Serbia
programme.desc: Heather explores Novi Sad, the financial and industrial hub of Serbia.Starting with canoeing on Danube and later exploring the city and its landmarks.

programme.title: Boarding Pass
programme.desc: Emeline Nsingi Nkosi goes to Santa Village at Rovaniemi, where she reads some of the letters that children from around the world write to him.

programme.title: Xplore Bulgaria
programme.desc: Luxurious hotels, thrilling water parks, inexpensive food and almost 300 days of bright sunny weather make Bulgaria’s biggest seaside resort, Sunny Beach popular for budget beach getaways. Catriona, however, stumbles onto the historic town of Nessebar, which is over 3000 years old, and realizes that there is more to the place than meets the eye. She goes on to visit the Castra Rubra winery, where she finds out about the history of Viticulture in Bulgaria and the process of wine making.

programme.title: City Breaks
programme.desc: Benafsha embarks on a whirlwind adventure in Ahmedabad. With just 48 hours in the city, she is determined to make the most of it, but how?

programme.title: Food Fact Fun
programme.desc: From exploring a vintage car museum to scaling a 5 meter ice-wall and sampling a rich bread cookie, Watch Alex exploring The Hague, also known as the “International city of peace”.

programme.title: 10 Days Scotland
programme.desc: A modern European oil city built on the back of a rich maritime heritage, Aberdeen is the energetic kingpin of northeast Scotland. While the boom times may come and go, the dynamic coastal metropolis never ceases to thrill with its free museums, outdoor adventures and natural attractions right on the city’s doorstep.

programme.title: Backpack Serbia
programme.desc: Heather explores Požarevac and visits the ancient town of Viminacium. Later visits National Museum, concluding with Majdanpek’s Rajkova Pecina Caves.

programme.title: Boarding Pass
programme.desc: Emeline Nsingi Nkosi goes to Rovaniemi, where she visits a husky farm and finds out about about breeding and raising huskies.

programme.title: Xplore Bulgaria
programme.desc: For the people of Sofia, preserving its heritage is sacrosanct, and this can be seen in the way the city's infrastructure is built around its archeological treasures. Catriona realizes this when she roams around the cobblestone streets of the city. With every monument she visits, she finds herself transported to a different era, right from Perperikon fort, which narrate stories of the Byzantine empire, to Boyana church, which is home to some of the earliest examples of medieval artwork.

programme.title: Great World Hotels
programme.desc: From lazing in hammocks by the beach to sipping drinks on a private yacht, Kim realizes that Maldives is the perfect destination to unwind in style.

programme.title: Food Fact Fun
programme.desc: From trying dishes like Stroopwafel and Palat Stoofvlees to visiting the Erasmus bridge, cube houses and wall painting on the streets, Alex explores Rotterdam.

programme.title: 10 Days Scotland
programme.desc: Since medieval times Aberdeenshire and its northwestern neighbour Moray have been the richest and most fertile regions of the Highlands. Aberdeenshire is famed for its Aberdeen Angus beef cattle, its many fine castles and the prosperous 'granite city' of Aberdeen.

programme.title: Backpack Serbia
programme.desc: Explore Majdanpek with our host as the city brings the viewers closer to the treasures strewn across the Serbian countryside.

programme.title: Boarding Pass
programme.desc: Levi is Finland's largest and fastest-growing ski destination. Emeline is here, to find out the exciting activities that Levi offers, in summer.

programme.title: Xplore Bhutan
programme.desc: With snow-capped peaks rising over primeval forests and traditional villages, Paro is like an Oriental Switzerland. On a visit to Paro, Radhika explores famous monasteries such as the Rinpung Dzong and Takstang Monastery, and learns the history and legends associated with them. Along the way, she finds out the secrets to the quintessential Bhutanese peace and contentment.

programme.title: Great World Hotels
programme.desc: An invigorating spa treatment, a cooking lesson, a snorkeling session – Kim has experiences in the Maldives that leave her completely rejuvenated.

programme.title: Food Fact Fun
programme.desc: From trying Orange zest beer and traditional Dutch dishes to exploring St.Martin's Cathedral, Dom Tower and enjoying go karting and stand up paddle boat ride, watch Alex enjoy his trip in Utrecht.

programme.title: 10 Days Scotland
programme.desc: In the enchanting landscapes of Inverness, Robbie’s journey takes a whimsical turn: from eccentric to downright magical.

programme.title: Backpack Serbia
programme.desc: Heather explores Nis,one of the oldest cities in Europe.She visits a concentration camp and later paraglides to end by watching a musical performance.

programme.title: Boarding Pass
programme.desc: Emeline goes to Ruka-Kuusamo, where she tries river rafting. She also meets a reindeer herder,who tells her about the unique ways of herding reindeer.

programme.title: Xplore Bhutan
programme.desc: Actress and travel enthusiast, Radhika Bangia explores the enigma that is Bhutan, when she visits Thimpu, the capital city with no traffic lights and no skyscrapers invading the skyline. Here, she checks out significant sights such as the Tibetan-style National Memorial Chorten, the National Library and the Folk Heritage Museum in order to understand more about the beliefs, history, architecture and cuisine of Bhutan.

programme.title: World Heritage
programme.desc: Explore the ancient heritage sites of Abu Simbel, the Philae complex of Nubia and the Hatshepsut Temple to unravel the mystical stories behind the ancient temples of Egypt.

programme.title: Food Fact Fun
programme.desc: Alex tries traditional Dutch food in Leiden, learns about Dutch history at Prinsenhof Museum, visits a Gothic church, a local cheese market and Delftware factory at Gouda.

programme.title: 10 Days Scotland
programme.desc: The grand finale of Robbie’s wild homecoming unfolds amidst the rugged beauty of the Isle of Skye.

programme.title: Backpack Serbia
programme.desc: Continue exploring Serbia with Heather as she visits the Manasija monastery, Resavska caves, ending with a joyride onboard Eight of Sargan rail line.

programme.title: With Love From Mauritius
programme.desc: Krisann and Nathan’s vacation in Mauritius begins in Le Morne, where an unexpected adventure awaits the latter.

programme.title: Xplore Bhutan
programme.desc: Known as Druk Yul or the “Land of the Thunder Dragon”, Bhutan is the country of mountains, monasteries and mystery. Radhika Bangia finds this to be true when she visits Punakha, the former capital of Bhutan, where she marvels at the architecture of Punakha Dzong and gets to know the story behind the two rivers, Mo Chhu and Po Chhu. She also explores the sacred temples and Mebar Tsho lake of Bumthang, the religious heart of Bhutan, and gets to know the local legends.

programme.title: World Spas
programme.desc: Jamie Srubis tries out spa treatments, which are inspired by the Dead Sea and the desert surroundings at Hotel Kempinski Ishtar in Jordan.

programme.title: Food Fact Fun
programme.desc: After Burj Khalifa, Alex has a traditional Emirati platter, visits the gold market and skiing rink, and goes for a camel safari and camping.

programme.title: City break
programme.desc: Nestled in the mighty Alps, tour the Austrian city of Innsbruck with Sabrina and explore a town that’s alpine-urban yet traditional in nature.

programme.title: Backpack Serbia
programme.desc: In her final leg of journey, Heather visits the Uvac canyon, tries locally prepared pie, ending with Kopaonik National Park and Jelovarnik waterfalls.

programme.title: With Love From Mauritius
programme.desc: On an island-hopping adventure in Mauritius, Krisann and Nathan find out that time works differently on these islands.

programme.title: XP Guide
programme.desc: A homely place where the aroma of freshly baked bread greets you as people smoothly glide along on their bicycles. Welcome to Copenhagen.

programme.title: Unwind
programme.desc: Indeya explores the Cinnamon plantations, tries a local dish and witnesses a traditional dance performance.

programme.title: Food Fact Fun
programme.desc: Alex has varied experiences in Dubai like trying Lebanese cheese bread, visiting a coffee museum, going to IMG Worlds of Adventure and more.

programme.title: Brindiamo! With Ornella Fado
programme.desc: Ornella Fado visita Frank Gullo al suo stabilimento "Gullo Seafood" per scoprire i segreti di un polpo perfetto, per poi andare con Mr.Octoman a preparare alcune ricette in due ristoranti a New York, "Perla" e "Quality Italian". (2014)

programme.title: Brindiamo! With Ornella Fado
programme.desc: Ornella Fado, si trova a Milano e visita uno storico ristorante stellato, "Aimo e Nadia", dove incontra ed intervista Stefania Moroni figlia della signora Nadia ed il signor Aimo. Nella bellissima cucina Ornella incontra due bravissimi chef come Fabio Pisani e Alessandro Negrini. Insieme preparano alcuni piatti classici del menù del ristorante di Aimo e Nadia.

programme.title: Brindiamo! With Ornella Fado
programme.desc: Nel 2015 Ornella Fado ha celebrato 10 anni di produzione televisiva e di messa in onda su NYC LIFE, il canale pubblico di New York. Questa puntata raccoglie alcuni dei momenti più belli del programma televisivo Brindiamo!

programme.title: Brindiamo! With Ornella Fado
programme.desc: Continua il viaggio dei 10 anni di Brindiamo! nella seconda parte Ornella viene presentata dal famoso conduttore televisio della WB 11, Howard Thompson grande fan di Brindiamo! Nella prima parte della puntata, Ornella visita il ristorante "Il Baluardo" nella regione Piemonte dove incontra lo chef Marc Lanteri. A Central Park, Ornella intervista la bellissima Barbara D'Urso e rivivono le emozioni del party " La dolce Vita" dove Barbara era l'ospite d'onore con Lee Curreri.

programme.title: Brindiamo! With Ornella Fado
programme.desc: Siamo alla terza ed ultima parte del viaggio dei 10 anni di Brindiamo! Prima tappa Montreal. Ornella visita il mercato Jean -Talon con Aldo, per poi andare da "Vinizza" per preparare alcune pizze.

programme.title: Brindiamo! With Ornella Fado
programme.desc: Ornella Fado si trova a St. George's Island, nelle Bermuda per filmare due favolosi episodi di Brindiamo! In questa prima puntata Ornella é in cucina con chef Michele Belotti e prepara alcune ricette per l'evento "Italian Night in Bermuda" che si terrà al St. George's Club.L'evento presentato da Ursula Avella, presidente della "Great Culinary Minds" e` stato un grande successo. (2015)

programme.title: Change your Destiny
programme.desc: Nella prima puntata Antonio Fini ed i suoi giudici incontrano il primo gruppo di ballerini.Per essere selezionati per il prestigioso festival di danza in NEW YORK devono affrontare 3 sfide: presentare il loro pezzo migliore, la contemporary battle e la lezione di danza "tecnica Graham" con il maestro Antonio Fini.

programme.title: Change your Destiny
programme.desc: Continuano le audizioni di Antonio Fini e dei suoi giudici per selezionare i migliori danzatori da invitare al prestigioso festival di danza in NEW YORK. I ragazzi affrontano le tre sfide previste: portare il loro pezzo migliore, la contemporary battle e la lezione di Hip hop con Mirco Giordano e Marcello Gargarelli.

programme.title: Change your Destiny
programme.desc: Terza ed ultima puntata della serie. Antonio Fini ed i suoi giudici sono pronti: chi sceglieranno per volare a NEW YORK per il prestigioso festival della danza? Ancora una volta i ragazzi devono convincere l'importante giuria con il loro pezzo migliore, la contemporary battle e la lezione di danza "tecnica Parson" con la maestra Abby Silva.

programme.title: Il CIRCOLO DEL BUONGUSTAI Con Fabio Campoli
programme.desc: Benvenuti a questo nuovo episodio del Circolo dei Buongustai! Cosa bolle in pentola? Oggi il nostro chef Fabio Campoli ci delizierà con tre ricette speciali: portafoglio di squacquerone, ciliegie e mortadella, riso rosso integrale con pollo e peperoni, diplomatico alle rose. Buona visione a tutti!

programme.title: Il CIRCOLO DEL BUONGUSTAI Con Fabio Campoli
programme.desc: Benvenuti a questo nuovo episodio del Circolo dei Buongustai! Cosa bolle in pentola? Oggi il nostro chef Fabio Campoli ci delizierà con tre ricette speciali: rotolo di riso, prosciutto e melone, risotto alla rucola con kiwi e vongole, e budino di riso. Buona visione a tutti!

programme.title: My Talented Friends Season 1
programme.desc: Ornella Fado presenta il lavoro artistico della sua amica Geniale,Paola Sinisgalli fondatrice della "Creative Shakes" il lavoro artistico di oggi e` un corto che vede Paola nei panni di regista.

programme.title: My Talented Friends Season 1
programme.desc: Ornella Fado introduce il suo amico Geniale Sergio Furnari, e presenta un docuemntario su un suo ultimo lavoro aritistico "Covid Hero Monument"

programme.title: Brindiamo! With Ornella Fado
programme.desc: Ornella Fado visita cinque amici ristoratori durante le feste Natalizie, prima tappa" Angelina's" a Staten Island, poi e` la volta di "Marco Polo" e "Luzzo" a Brooklyn. A Manhattan nell'Upper East side, Ornella visita "83 e mezza". Ultima tappa per ujn buon gelato,"Dolce Gelateria" nel Village. (2013)

programme.title: Brindiamo!
programme.desc: Questa puntata fa parte della serie vintage. Ornella Fado visita uno dei ristoranti più eleganti di Manhattan a due passi da Central Park il "San Domenico ristorante". Nella cucina del ristorante Ornella assiste Odette Fada nella preparazione dei classici piatti Italiani. Ospite della puntata la giovane stilista Nicole Romano. Ornella Fado indossa alcune creazioni della sua collezione. (2007)

programme.title: Brindiamo!
programme.desc: Questa puntata fa parte della serie vintage. Ornella Fado visita una delle più belle scuole di cucine upstate in New York la "CIA" Culinary Institute of America, dove visita il ristorante "Caterina dei Medici", e con lo chef Scapin preprano alcune ricette del menù della scuola. (2007)

programme.title: Brindiamo!
programme.desc: Questa puntata fa parte della serie vintage. Ornella Fado visita Raffaele Trovato, direttore dell'IFSE, a Piobesi Torinese, oltre a visitare la bellissima scuola, Ornella prepara delle ricette con l'istruttore del centro.(2009)

programme.title: Brindiamo!
programme.desc: Questa puntata fa parte della serie vintage. Ornella Fado visita il ristorante "Il Tartufo" a Manayunk, poco distante da Filadelfia, dove incontra Al Del Bello, per preparare alcune ricette tipiche del ristorante. In questa puntata Ornella indossa i guanti da boxer per correre come Rocky Balboa sulla scalinata del museo d'arte di Filadelfia. (2007)

programme.title: Brindiamo!
programme.desc: Questa puntata fa parte della serie vintage. Ornella Fado visita Al Del Bello al suo ristorante "Il Portico", uno dei ristoranti più raffinati di Filadelfia. Al racconta la sua storia di gratidudine nei confronti della famiglia Lattanzi proprietari di ristoratori italiani a New York. (2006)

programme.title: Brindiamo!
programme.desc: La puntata di oggi è ricca di contenuti. Ornella Fado incontra Cristina Carrani, esperta in materia immobiliare che aiuterà Ornella a scoprire l'Isola di Capri. Dalla moda alla storia, al cibo e all'arte, Brindiamo! Edizione speciale Capri è l'episodio perfetto per festeggiare i 18 anni di Brindiamo! su NYC LIFE.

programme.title: Brindiamo!
programme.desc: Questa puntata fa parte della serie vintage. Ornella Fado, visita il ristorante "etc.etc". nel cuore di Manhattan per preparare le ricette tipiche del ristorante con lo chef Stefano Terzi. In questa puntata l'ospite è il celebre pianista, Giovanni Allevi, reduce da un favoloso concerto al Carnegie Hall. Ornella intervista Giovanni passeggiando in carrozza a Central Park. (2005)

programme.title: Brindiamo!
programme.desc: Questa puntata fa parte della serie vintage. Ornella Fado visita uno dei ristoranti più raffinati di Georgetown, una elegante cittadina a pochi passi da Washington DC, un ristorante per osservare e per farsi osservare, in inglese si dice "To see and to be seeying". A "Cafe` Milano" Ornella incontra Franco Nushese, che racconta il suo sogno americano. Arrivato da Minori, Franco Nuschese, conquista l' America con l'alta ristorazione e il suo charm Italiano.

programme.title: Brindiamo!
programme.desc: Questa puntata fa parte della serie vintage. Ornella Fado si trova in Piemonte per scorpire il territorio e visitare alcuni ristoranti stellati. In questa puntata Ornella visita la Reggia di Venaria, dove il Re del ristorante "Dolce Stil Novo", chef Alfredo Russo prepara nella spaziosa e super moderna cucina delle prelibatezze tipiche piemontesi. Ornella visita anche la scuola di restauro e parla con la responsabile della scuola Dr.

programme.title: Brindiamo!
programme.desc: Questa puntata fa parte della serie vintage. Ornella Fado visita Gente, dove incontra Jay Mitchel un americano appassionato di Italia al punto di aprire un suo ristorante in america per far apprezzare il cibo Italiano ad i suoi clienti.

programme.title: Brindiamo!
programme.desc: Questa puntata fa parte della serie vintage. Ornella Fado visita il ristorante Barolo, nel cuore di Soho ed incontra il proprietario Paolo Secondo, che oltre a preparare una squsita focaccia Genovese, racconta la sua storia di giovane imprenditore italiano a New York.

programme.title: Brindiamo!
programme.desc: Questa puntata fa parte della serie vintage.Ornella Fado, visita il ristorante stellato Cascinale Novo, dove incontra chef Walter Ferreto e preparano delle tipiche ricette Piemontesi. Ornella inoltre visitare la casa del Trifolao di Natale Romagnolo per una caccia al tartufo Bianco.

programme.title: Brindiamo!
programme.desc: Questa puntata fa parte della serie vintage. Ornella Fado, visita il ristorante "etc.etc". nel cuore di Manhattan per preparare le ricette tipiche del ristorante con lo chef Stefano Terzi. In questa puntata l'ospite è il celebre pianista, Giovanni Allevi, reduce da un favoloso concerto al Carnegie Hall. Ornella intervista Giovanni passeggiando in carrozza a Central Park. (2005)

programme.title: Brindiamo! With Ornella Fado
programme.desc: Ornella Fado si trova nel laboratorio di Urbani Truffle a New York ed invita i suoi amici chef per preparare insieme delle ricette da gustare durante le festività natalizie. In questa puntata Chef Pino Coladonato, Chef Marcello Russodivito e la giovane pizzaiola Giorgia Caporuscio. In questa edizione di Brindiamo! in my Kitchen ospite speciale la soprano Cristina Fontanelli e John La Barbera, oltre a vari ospiti del mondo dello spettacolo, e della moda. (2016)

programme.title: Brindiamo! With Ornella Fado
programme.desc: Ornella Fado si trova nel laboratorio di Urbani Truffle a New York per la serconda parte di Brindiamo! in my kitchen. I suoi amici chef in questa puntata son lo chef Raffaele Ronca, lo Chef Marco Chirico e il giovane pizzaiolo Ettore Toches. In questa edizione di Brindiamo! in my Kitchen la musica è dal vivo con la soprano Cristina Fontanelli ed il compositore Jhon La Barbera, tra gli ospiti di questa puntata il Fashion designer Domenico Vacca. (2016)

programme.title: Brindiamo! With Ornella Fado

A Manhattan nell'Upper East side, Ornella visita "83 e mezza". Ultima tappa per ujn buon gelato,"Dolce Gelateria" nel Village. (2013)

programme.title: Brindiamo! With Ornella Fado
programme.desc: Ornella Fado continua il suo giro per incontrare il suoi amici ristoratori durante le festività di capodanno. Visitando a midtown Chef Pino alla "La Masseria", chef Stefano e Franco a " Viceversa", a "PizzArte" incontra il pizzaiolo Roberto ed il proprietario Dario, a Queens visita "Ornella Trattoria" dove incontra Vincenzo e "Trattoria l'Incontro"dove incontra lo chef e proprietario Rocco. (2013/2014)

programme.title: Eccellenze Italiane con Piero Muscari intervista a Heinz Beck
programme.desc: Pietro Muscari intervista Enrico Vaime, autore e conduttore radio e TV. Con Enrico si parla di radio, tv, libri, ma anche di amore e dispiaceri che hanno formato la sua carriera.

programme.title: Eccellenze Italiane con Piero Muscari intervista a Heinz Beck
programme.desc: Pietro Muscari intervista la regista e sceneggiatrice Lina Wertmüller. Prima donna nella storia ad essere candidata all' Oscar come miglior regista, Lina racconta il suo rapporto con grandi personaggi del cinema come Lelio Luttazzi e Federico Fellini.

programme.title: My Talented Friends Season 1
programme.desc: Ornella Fado, passa una giornata a New York con il suo amico Geniale, il Maestro Antonio Ciacca, e tra una chiacchierata a Lincoln Center ed una passeggiata a Central Park, arrivano al prestigiosto Pier Hotel dove il Maestro Ciacca si esibisce regolarmente. in questo episodio di "MY TALENTED FRIENDS" scoprirete la storia di successo del Maestro Ciacca in un pccolo documentario MY JAZZ LIFE.

programme.desc: Ornella Fado è ancora in Bermuda, e questa volta oltre a preparare alcuni piatti con l' executive chef del "Griffin's Bistro" Pietro Casalicchio. Ornella visita le meraviglie dell'isola via mare.

programme.title: Brindiamo! With Ornella Fado
programme.desc: Ornella Fado si trova a Milano esattamente all'EXPO. Incontra un gruppo di ragazzi della regione Basilicata, che partecipano al progetto "Sano è Lucano", e hanno portato alcuni prodotti tipici della regione Basilicata, che Ornella utilizza per cucinare alcune ricette con Jasmin sulla barca, con Antonio alla libreria Mondadori di Milano, con Nicolò a "Lady Bu Bistrò", e con Fabio Pisani al ristorante stellato di Aimo e Nadia.(2015)

programme.title: Brindiamo! With Ornella Fado
programme.desc: Ornella Fado si trova in una delle città più belle al mondo, Venezia, e visita il "Centurion Palace", dove incontra lo chef veneziano Massimo Livan al ristorante "Antinoo's Lounge". Con chef Massimo, Ornella prepara dei piatti ispirati ai dipinti d' arte moderna. Durante la visita al "Centurion Palace" incontra il General Manager Paolo Morra, e davanti ad un cocktail tutto veneziano Paolo racconta la storia di questo storico palazzo. (2015)

programme.title: Brindiamo! With Ornella Fado
programme.desc: Ornella Fado si trova in Florida ospite di un eccezionale evento organizzato da Ursula Avella Presidente di "Great Culinary Minds". L 'evento si è svolto al ristorante "Valentino Cucina Italiana". Ospite di Ornella è il talentuoso chef Mauro Uliassi, all'epoca 2 stelle Michelin, ora 3. Ospite d'eccezione di questa puntata il cantautore Raf che incontra Ornella su una spiaggia di Miami. (2015)

programme.title: Brindiamo! With Ornella Fado
programme.desc: Ornella Fado si trova a Brooklyn e visita il ristorante di Joe e chef Marco Chirico per preparare alcune specialità del ristorante. Prima di andare in cucina, Chef Marco preprare alcuni cocktail creati da lui, immaginate che chef Marco prepara i suoi liquori, come il limoncello e il mandarincello. La Happy hours al ristorante di Marco Polo è una combinazione di delizie tipiche italiane, formaggi e salumi ed una presentazione di frutti di mare, ostriche e gamberi.(2015)

programme.title: Brindiamo! With Ornella Fado
programme.desc: Ornella Fado prosegue il suo viaggio culinario nel ristorante Enoteca, il ristorante si trova affianco a Marco Polo. Enoteca è il regno di Chef Marco Chirico, ed e` propio ad Enoteca che chef Marco prepara piatti sempre più originali come il Vulcano Pizza e il Cannolo Pizza (2015)

programme.title: Brindiamo!
programme.desc: In questa puntata, Ornella Fado conduce un favoloso evento dedicato alla Regione Calabria da Eataly Downtown, preparando ricette insieme allo chef calabrese Luca Caligiuro e allo chef italo-americano Ryan Rizzuto.

programme.title: Brindiamo!
programme.desc: Ornella Fado è a Milano, all'EXPO, con i giovani della Basilicata del progetto Sano è Lucano. I prodotti tipici lucani ispirano una serie di incontri culinari: dalla barca alla Mondadori, fino a Lady Bu Bistrò e al ristorante stellato Il Luogo di Aimo e Nadia con lo chef Fabio Pisani.Il racconto è arricchito dagli interventi di Sara Farnetti e Pietro Bitonti.

programme.title: Brindiamo!

programme.title: Brindiamo! With Ornella Fado

A Manhattan nell'Upper East side, Ornella visita "83 e mezza". Ultima tappa per ujn buon gelato,"Dolce Gelateria" nel Village. (2013)

programme.title: Il CIRCOLO DEL BUONGUSTAI Con Fabio Campoli
programme.desc: Benvenuti a questo nuovo episodio del Circolo dei Buongustai! Cosa bolle in pentola? Oggi il nostro chef Fabio Campoli ci delizierà con tre ricette speciali: cono di stesa, venere nera, e babà al bergamotto. Buona visione a tutti!

programme.title: Il CIRCOLO DEL BUONGUSTAI Con Fabio Campoli
programme.desc: Benvenuti a questo nuovo episodio del Circolo dei Buongustai! Cosa bolle in pentola? Oggi il nostro chef Fabio Campoli ci delizierà con tre ricette speciali: portafoglio di squacquerone, ciliegie e mortadella, riso rosso integrale con pollo e peperoni, diplomatico alle rose. Buona visione a tutti!

programme.title: Il CIRCOLO DEL BUONGUSTAI Con Fabio Campoli
programme.desc: Benvenuti a questo nuovo episodio del Circolo dei Buongustai! Cosa bolle in pentola? Oggi il nostro chef Fabio Campoli ci delizierà con tre ricette speciali: rotolo di riso, prosciutto e melone, risotto alla rucola con kiwi e vongole, e budino di riso. Buona visione a tutti!

programme.title: Change your Destiny
programme.desc: Nella prima puntata Antonio Fini ed i suoi giudici incontrano il primo gruppo di ballerini.Per essere selezionati per il prestigioso festival di danza in NEW YORK devono affrontare 3 sfide: presentare il loro pezzo migliore, la contemporary battle e la lezione di danza "tecnica Graham" con il maestro Antonio Fini.

programme.title: Change your Destiny
programme.desc: Continuano le audizioni di Antonio Fini e dei suoi giudici per selezionare i migliori danzatori da invitare al prestigioso festival di danza in NEW YORK. I ragazzi affrontano le tre sfide previste: portare il loro pezzo migliore, la contemporary battle e la lezione di Hip hop con Mirco Giordano e Marcello Gargarelli.

programme.title: Brindiamo!
programme.desc: La puntata di oggi è ricca di contenuti. Ornella Fado incontra Cristina Carrani, esperta in materia immobiliare che aiuterà Ornella a scoprire l'Isola di Capri. Dalla moda alla storia, al cibo e all'arte, Brindiamo! Edizione speciale Capri è l'episodio perfetto per festeggiare i 18 anni di Brindiamo! su NYC LIFE.

programme.title: Brindiamo! With Ornella Fado
programme.desc: Ornella Fado si trova nel laboratorio di Urbani Truffle a New York ed invita i suoi amici chef per preparare insieme delle ricette da gustare durante le festività natalizie. In questa puntata Chef Pino Coladonato, Chef Marcello Russodivito e la giovane pizzaiola Giorgia Caporuscio. In questa edizione di Brindiamo! in my Kitchen ospite speciale la soprano Cristina Fontanelli e John La Barbera, oltre a vari ospiti del mondo dello spettacolo, e della moda. (2016)

programme.title: Brindiamo! With Ornella Fado
programme.desc: Ornella Fado si trova nel laboratorio di Urbani Truffle a New York per la serconda parte di Brindiamo! in my kitchen. I suoi amici chef in questa puntata son lo chef Raffaele Ronca, lo Chef Marco Chirico e il giovane pizzaiolo Ettore Toches. In questa edizione di Brindiamo! in my Kitchen la musica è dal vivo con la soprano Cristina Fontanelli ed il compositore Jhon La Barbera, tra gli ospiti di questa puntata il Fashion designer Domenico Vacca. (2016)

programme.title: Brindiamo! With Ornella Fado

A Manhattan nell'Upper East side, Ornella visita "83 e mezza". Ultima tappa per ujn buon gelato,"Dolce Gelateria" nel Village. (2013)

programme.title: Brindiamo! With Ornella Fado
programme.desc: Ornella Fado continua il suo giro per incontrare il suoi amici ristoratori durante le festività di capodanno. Visitando a midtown Chef Pino alla "La Masseria", chef Stefano e Franco a " Viceversa", a "PizzArte" incontra il pizzaiolo Roberto ed il proprietario Dario, a Queens visita "Ornella Trattoria" dove incontra Vincenzo e "Trattoria l'Incontro"dove incontra lo chef e proprietario Rocco. (2013/2014)

programme.title: Brindiamo! With Ornella Fado
programme.desc: Ornella Fado organizza un favoloso evento al Michelangelo Hotel di New York City, ospite d' eccezione Mara Martini, ristoratrice e chef stellata veneziana. Tra gli ospiti il biologo e star televisiva Jeff Corwin. In questa puntata Ornella incontra il General Manager Maurizio Benevento che racconta la storia del Michelangelo, unico hotel Italiano nel cuore di Manhattan. Ospite Tony Margiotta autore del libro "Hidden Gems of Italy". (2018)

programme.title: Brindiamo! With Ornella Fado
programme.desc: Ornella Fado visita la Puglia una delle regioni più pittoresche d'Italia per un viaggio indimenticabile. Dai tipici Trulli di Alberobello, alle grotte di Castellana. Rientrata in America, Ornella incontra chef Pino Coladonato al ristorante "La Masseria", per rivivere alcuni momenti del suo favoloso viaggio pugliese, tramite le ricette di chef Coladonato. (2019)

programme.title: Brindiamo! With Ornella Fado
programme.desc: Ornella Fado festeggia il decimo anniversario di "Enoteca Ristorante" e con Chef Marco Chirico preparano piatti originali, tra cui la pizza tiramisù e gustosi cocktail. Ornella e Marco Incontrano Tom Perrotta a Fort Meat, grossista di carne, dove si rifornisce Enoteca Ristorante. Ornella intervista Giuseppe "Jo" Chirico Patron di Marco Polo storico ristorante di Brooklyn ed Enoteca Ristorante.

programme.title: Change your Destiny
programme.desc: Terza ed ultima puntata della serie. Antonio Fini ed i suoi giudici sono pronti: chi sceglieranno per volare a NEW YORK per il prestigioso festival della danza? Ancora una volta i ragazzi devono convincere l'importante giuria con il loro pezzo migliore, la contemporary battle e la lezione di danza "tecnica Parson" con la maestra Abby Silva.

programme.title: My Talented Friends Season 1
programme.desc: Ornella Fado, passa una giornata a New York con il suo amico Geniale, il Maestro Antonio Ciacca, e tra una chiacchierata a Lincoln Center ed una passeggiata a Central Park, arrivano al prestigiosto Pier Hotel dove il Maestro Ciacca si esibisce regolarmente. in questo episodio di "MY TALENTED FRIENDS" scoprirete la storia di successo del Maestro Ciacca in un pccolo documentario MY JAZZ LIFE.

programme.title: My Talented Friends Season 1
programme.desc: Ornella Fado introduce il suo amico Geniale Julian Gargiulo, un talentuosissimo compositore e pianista on uno spiccato senso dell'umore, Julian e` il protagnosita e regista di un documentario girato al Carnegie Hall di New York, durante una competizione ideada dal maestro Gargiiulo.

programme.title: Eccellenze Italiane con Piero Muscari intervista a Heinz Beck
programme.desc: Pietro Muscari intervista Enrico Vaime, autore e conduttore radio e TV. Con Enrico si parla di radio, tv, libri, ma anche di amore e dispiaceri che hanno formato la sua carriera.
